entry: Black Reliquary sera une aventure radicalement différente. Abandonnez ce que vous croyez savoir. La plupart des mécaniques ont été modifiées, et certains héros ont bénéficié de changements majeurs. Ce qui n'a pas changé, c'est que lorsque vos héros meurent, ils restent morts.

Les défis auxquels vous serez confrontés vous demanderont beaucoup d'efforts. Votre capacité d'adaptation sera mise à l'épreuve. Vous ne connaîtrez que peu de pitié, mais vos victoires n'en seront que plus méritées.
Des visages familiers et de nouvelles têtes se mêleront à votre campagne de bravoure, de fortune et de rédemption contre les ténèbres naissantes du...
Rejoignez-nous sur Discord et suivez-nous sur Twitter ! Malheureusement, nous ne pouvons pas ajouter de lien vers nos réseaux sociaux.
Ce message concerne uniquement la collecte de données du DLC The Butcher's Circus. Black Reliquary ne collecte pas vos données.
Cliquez sur la lettre pour démarrer
La campagne reliquaire représente les paramètres "originaux" du jeu. Si vous connaissez déjà Darkest Dungeon, vos compétences seront mises à l'épreuve.
Faites glisser les mods pour établir l'ordre de priorité. Le haut de la liste a la plus haute priorité.
Votre version de Black Reliquary est maintenant à jour
Faites glisser ici un OBJET DE QUÊTE depuis l'inventaire.

Ces ruines Kvarotz sont noyées dans les sables. Identifiez ce qui est navigable.
Fouillez ces ruines dans le sable et rapportez tout ce qui pourrait nous être utile.
Les vestiges des édifices Kvarotz abritent certainement des informations qui pourraient nous servir.
Ces ruines Kvarotz sont noyées dans les sables. Identifiez ce qui est navigable.
Fouillez ces ruines dans le sable et rapportez tout ce qui pourrait nous être utile.
Les vestiges des édifices Kvarotz abritent certainement des informations qui pourraient nous servir.
La technologie Kvarotz et les fournitures levantines sont abondantes ici. Ramenez tout ce que vous pourrez.
Des ressources précieuses sont abondantes au cœur de ces vestiges poussiéreux.
Nous avons besoin de cartes de la Nécropole pour faciliter la récupération de matériel.
Il n'y a pas d'endroit plus propice à l'ambre que ces immondes galeries.
Naviguez dans ce labyrinthe de tunnels pour vous approvisionner, et exterminez la vermine au passage.
Fouillez ces cavernes à la recherche de matériaux, et tracez votre route pour de futures excursions.
D'immenses richesses nous attendent dans la Trésorerie, mais il faudra se battre pour en profiter.
Chaque carte de la Trésorerie facilite un peu plus le pillage de ses richesses.
Repérez les pièges et les trésors, et nous récolterons les fruits de vos efforts.
Les sauvages n'ont pas leur place dans cette vallée. Nous devons chasser les clans de ces terres.
Si ces sauvages cherchent le sang et la violence, ils ne seront pas déçus.
Les ruines Kvarotz sont trop habitées pour que nous puissions les piller. Il est temps de remédier à ce problème.
Les sauvages n'ont pas leur place dans cette vallée. Nous devons chasser les clans de ces terres.
Si ces sauvages cherchent le sang et la violence, ils ne seront pas déçus.
Les ruines Kvarotz sont trop habitées pour que nous puissions les piller. Il est temps de remédier à ce problème.
Les campements levantins ne feront que s'étendre si nous n'endiguons pas cette marée.
Interceptez leurs éclaireurs avant qu'ils ne retournent auprès de leurs commandants.
Reprenez le contrôle de certaines sections de la Nécropole. Chaque centimètre que nous revendiquons est une victoire.
Les troglodytes ne doivent pas être laissés sans surveillance. Mettez fin à leurs sinistres machinations.
Les troglodytes se reproduisent massivement. Il est temps de réduire leurs nombres, une fois de plus.
Un mal terrible se forme au plus profond du labyrinthe caverneux. Nous allons l'entraver de la manière la plus directe possible.
Il est temps de récolter les fruits de nos efforts cartographiques.
Nous retournons dans les couloirs de la richesse, afin de collecter ce que nous avons mérité.
De petits gisements de richesses ont été repérés et cartographiés. Il suffit de s'en emparer.

TODO:The Flayed prowls here this week. {colour_start|skill_unselectable}(50ʪ Chance to Encounter in Champ){colour_end}
Quelque chose nous appelle depuis les dunes...
TODO:We venture into the valley for the first time. The catacombs of the Kvarotz are a dangerous place in their own right, but the Levantine have made it their new dig site.
TODO:{?hero_names}%s retreated from our very first endeavor. This does not bode well.
TODO:{?hero_names}%s have become familiar with the valley. This is only the beginning.
TODO:{?hero_names}%s were the first to Enter the Catacombs
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Les Levantins sont venus piller la vaste nécropole Kvarotz.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} L'électrum rouillé Kvarotz peut être revitalisé avec de l'huile.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} La technologie macabre et les connaissances des Kvarotz renferment de dangereux pouvoirs.
L'un des généraux les plus talentueux du Vizir se dresse fièrement dans son camp, nous indiquant ouvertement où il se trouve et se vantant de nous offrir une mort honorable.
{?hero_names}%s ont échoués. La proposition du Janissaire tiens toujours.
{?hero_names}%s ont gagné avec honneur contre le Janissaire.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Le Janissaire insiste sur l'importance des duels, à un contre un.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Le Janissaire peut faire appel à ses troupes, pour combattre les héros qu'il n'affronte pas en duel.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Agile et versatile, le Janissaire ne sera pas une cible facile.
Un général du Vizir nous a révélé sa position, elle souhaite nous éradiquer. Il ne faudrait pas laisser son défi sans réponse.
{?hero_names}%s ont échoués. La défi de l'Enchanteresse tiens toujours.
{?hero_names}%s ont mis un terme aux pratiques de l'Enchanteresse.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Vos héros les plus vulnérables au poison seront en grand danger.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} De nombreux serpents se dresseront pour défendre l'Enchanteresse.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} D'énormes serpents peuvent frapper depuis des endroits inattendus.
L'une des matriarches nous a fait connaître son camp, nous mettant directement au défi. Mettez fin à son règne.
{?hero_names}%s étaient trop faibles pour la Matrone de guerre. Les rires de son clan résonnent dans les dunes.
{?hero_names}%s ont éliminé la Matrone de guerre.
{?hero_names}%s sont partis combattre la Matrone de guerre.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Les différentes munitions de la Matrone ont des propriétés particulières.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Les attaques de la Matrone sont variées et peuvent facilement toucher votre équipe.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} La Matrone a besoin de temps pour charger ses munitions.
Une autre matriarche exige un combat, se manifestant à nous depuis les ruines englouties par le sable. Calmez ses ardeurs.
{?hero_names}%s étaient trop faibles pour la Matrone de fer. La soif de sang de son clan est de plus en plus forte.
{?hero_names}%s ont éliminé la Matrone de fer.
{?hero_names}%s sont partis combattre la Matrone de fer.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} La Matrone prospère contre les adversaires qui se vident de leur sang.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Les hyènes sont aussi assoiffées de sang que leur maîtresse.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Attendez-vous à ce que vos héros saignent généreusement.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} La violence de la matrone n'est que temporaire, elle devra se reposer.
Les troglodytes sont parvenus à créer une monstruosité. Chaque jour qui passe, elle se rassasie et grandit. Détruisez cette abomination
{?hero_names}%s n'ont pas pu calmer la violence du Gastrosaure.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Plus sa santé diminue, plus le Gastrosaure devient violent.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} La carapace du Gastrosaure est robuste. L'huile d'affûtage pourrait être utile.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Se préparer contre le saignement et l'infection sera essentiel.
Une menace de taille nous bloque le passage dans le territoire des troglodytes. Il faudra employer de méthodes peu conventionnelles ...
{?hero_names}%s ont échoué contre le Dévoreur des sables.
{?hero_names}%s ont abattu le Dévoreur des sables.
{?hero_names}%s sont partis combattre le Dévoreur des sables.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Le Chasseur de la Flamme déversera sa puissance de feu, au moment opportun.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} La peau du Dévoreur est bien trop résistante pour être attaquée directement.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Chaque bête, quelle que soit sa taille, a un point faible. Il faut juste le {colour_start|mark}révéler{colour_end}.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Vos héros ne seront pas en mesure d'achever le Dévoreur, ils auront besoin d'aide.
Un passage important est gardé par une masse cactonide d'un attrait dérangeant...
{?hero_names}%s ont embarqué dans le bosquet de l'Alrune.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Les prétendants de l'Alrune se calmeront seulement lorsqu'un héros sera à leur portée.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} La clé est de gérer la personne la plus apte à se battre.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Les équipes équilibrées pourront se remettre de l'emprise des prétendants.
Un autre cactonide est prêt à être cueilli. La destruction de cet ensemble de lianes et de racines est indispensable pour atteindre le Reliquaire.
{?hero_names}%s n'ont pas traversé les défenses du Cœur nucléique.
{?hero_names}%s ont détruit les défenses du Cœur nucléique.
{?hero_names}%s sont partis détruire le Cœur nucléique.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Les défenses prendront la forme qu'il faut afin de protéger le Cœur.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Les défenses ne peuvent pas survivre sans le Cœur.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Des défenses différentes auront des effets différents.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Une équipe polyvalente sera nécessaire pour s'adapter aux défenses changeantes.
Nous avons enfin trouvé la Mère des goules. Elle a pillé les biens de nos héros tombés au combat, et les a entassés dans son infâme repaire. Reprenons ce que nous avons perdu !
{?hero_names}%s ont échoué dans leur expédition contre la Mère des goules.
{?hero_names}%s ont récupéré leurs babioles, auprès avoir chassé la Mère des goules.
{?hero_names}%s sont partis combattre la Mère des goules.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} La Mère des goules n'hésitera pas à dévorer ses enfants si cela lui permet de survivre.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Préparez votre esprit à faire face aux assauts assourdissants de la Mère des goules.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Si nous résistons, la Mère des goules s'enfuira sans son butin.
Nos éclaireurs ont localisés une grotte remplie de trésors, tous ramassés par la Mère des goules. Résistez-lui et récupérez ce qui nous revient de droit.
{?hero_names}%s ont échoué dans leur expédition contre la Mère des goules.
{?hero_names}%s ont récupéré leurs babioles, auprès avoir chassé la Mère des goules.
{?hero_names}%s sont partis combattre la Mère des goules.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} La Mère des goules n'hésitera pas à dévorer ses enfants si cela lui permet de survivre.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Préparez votre esprit à faire face aux assauts assourdissants de la Mère des goules.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Si nous résistons, la Mère des goules s'enfuira sans son butin.
La Mère des goules a récupéré %d breloques ! Nettoyez son antre.
Résistez à la Mère des goules pour récupérer %d breloques.

TODO:There is a terrifying entity down in the sands. Since it began pulsing its beacon, the sun has gone dark over the valley. Whatever is causing this, it must be stopped by any means, before someone comes to meddle with powers beyond their grasp.
TODO:{?hero_names}%s were repelled from the ecliptic beacon.
TODO:{?hero_names}%s defeated the Flayed... for now.
TODO:{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} The daylight is aberrant and unnerving, and has unique properties.
TODO:A murder has taken place aboard the ship and the killer is yet to be identified. Investigate the crew aboard the ship to determine the culprit.
TODO:The Otekh absconded from the ship after defeating {?hero_names}%s.
TODO:{?hero_names}%s revealed the Otekh before it could do any further damage.
TODO:{?hero_names}%s conducted an investigation aboard the airship.

TODO:When heroes {colour_start|notable}can't take the {colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end} any more{colour_end}, they can become {colour_start|harmful}AFFLICTED{colour_end}. This manifests in {colour_start|notable}different behaviors{colour_end} and {colour_start|notable}stat changes{colour_end}. {colour_start|harmful}Afflictions{colour_end} last until you {colour_start|notable}send them to treatment{colour_end} on the Flameseeker, unless you can reduce their {colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end} to zero during the quest.

TODO:Your hero has a {colour_start|symptom}symptom{colour_end}! {colour_start|disease}Diseases{colour_end} begin with {colour_start|symptom}Symptoms{colour_end} which are more gentle than the fully contracted {colour_start|disease}Diseases{colour_end}. Disease kit provision items can be used to remove the symptoms, or lessen the effects of evolved diseases. Barring few exceptions, diseases can only be removed in the {colour_start|notable}Clinic{colour_end}.

TODO:Your hero is {colour_start|expiated}Expiated{colour_end}!
New statuses are applied in combat from both friends and foes, such as {colour_start|amberblighted}Amberblight{colour_end}, {colour_start|expiated}Expiation{colour_end}, and {colour_start|enraged}Enraged{colour_end}. {colour_start|amberblighted}Amberblight{colour_end} debuffs target's damage received or dealt based on their last action, {colour_start|expiated}Expiation{colour_end} damages the target on their next three attacks while healing the opposing party on the first one, and {colour_start|enraged}Enrage{colour_end} provides target with health and buffs upon killing their enemies. There are more statuses like that, which are applied by some specific enemy factions. Hover over the status icon on an affected target for more information.

TODO:Camping consists of two parts: {colour_start|notable}Meal phase{colour_end} and {colour_start|notable}Skill phase{colour_end}. During the {colour_start|notable}Meal phase{colour_end}, you choose how much they eat, which determines recovery. Make sure you have enough food! {colour_start|notable}Skill Phase{colour_end} allows you to spend {colour_start|notable}Respite{colour_end} on different hero skills used for recuperation. Additionally, when camping under the {colour_start|sun_torch}sun{colour_end} of Exposed Interior, ambush prevention is not necessary.

TODO:Quest durations have been adjusted to be slightly longer, and now all missions include 1 more {colour_start|notable}firewood{colour_end} than before. Be sure to supply yourself in anticipation of more fights, blockages, and hunger. Short quests are strongly recommended for less experienced or prepared heroes.

TODO:Enemies and allies alike take advantage of a moment to brace themselves during the first round of combat. {colour_start|notable}Accuracy for ordinary attacks is halved and critical hits are impossible{colour_end}, some abilities however can ignore the Accuracy reduction of the {colour_start|notable}Prep Round{colour_end} and can be used for an initiating strike. Additionally, {colour_start|notable}certain hero skills have their effects altered during the Prep Round{colour_end}, so be sure to read over your heroes' skill descriptions.

TODO:The first of many heroes has given their all in service to you. You have the option of {colour_start|notable}retreating from combat{colour_end} and abandoning this quest to save the others, or {colour_start|notable}press onward{colour_end}. The choice is yours.
TODO:Discretion is the better part of valor...
TODO:A rarer iteration of Room Curios, Vendors accept only a specific type of item and offer up valuables in exchange.

TODO:In Black Reliquary, inventory has seen some changes to better integrate with the changes made to other systems. On top of two additional inventory slots, some items such as food, gold and gems had their stack size increased. Additionally, gems themselves are worth more than before. As for the loot changes, the Relics (previously heirlooms) are now obtained in much higher numbers in their specific dungeons, so make sure to pick your missions wisely.

TODO:When a hero is reduced to 0 HP, they are at {colour_start|harmful}Death's Door{colour_end}. Heroes start with the maximum amount of {colour_start|harmful}Deathblow{colour_end} Resist. While in this state, they will suffer {colour_start|notable}stat penalties{colour_end}, plus any further damage has a {colour_start|notable}chance to kill them{colour_end}. Successive attacks received on and attacks that bring heroes to {colour_start|harmful}Death's Door{colour_end} lower their {colour_start|harmful}Deathblow{colour_end} slightly for an extensive duration. {colour_start|notable}Heal{colour_end} them to get off {colour_start|deathdoor}Death's Door{colour_end}!

TODO:Scouted {colour_start|trap}traps{colour_end} will be {colour_start|notable}visible on the ground{colour_end} as you approach them. Select a hero and then {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} on the {colour_start|trap}trap{colour_end} to attempt to {colour_start|notable}disarm it{colour_end}. Some heroes are better than others at disarming, and Archaeology Kits can provide increased trap disarm chance when used.

TODO:Facilities in the {colour_start|notable}Amber Workshop{colour_end} generate resources while you are on a quest! Remember to put heroes to work weekly to keep up your resource gain. From there, clicking on the {colour_start|notable}[EMBARK]{colour_end} button at the bottom of the screen!

TODO:Hero panels now contain information about a class's various details which would be otherwise hidden in the {colour_start|notable}Hero Info{colour_end}. This shows information such as virtue chance, crit effects, riposte information, and more should that class have any other unique properties.

TODO:{colour_start|harmful}Stress{colour_end} continues to build beyond the point of {colour_start|harmful}Affliction{colour_end}. If a hero's stress bar fills a second time completely, their {colour_start|harmful}body will give out{colour_end}. Get them aid or retreat back to the Flameseeker before this happens. Death awaits us all.
Le corps atteint sa limite : Crise cardiaque

TODO:The display for the enemies' skills has been updated, and now in addition to showing more of the skills' effects, it also includes information about where and on what targets the skills can used on. In Info Comms, accessible via either the {colour_start|notable}[G]{colour_end} hotkey or the main menu, you can see the explanations on meaning for each of the icons. Just like before, a skill needs to be seen to show up on that panel.

TODO:Some monsters have high {colour_start|notable}PROT{colour_end}, which {colour_start|notable}absorbs attack damage{colour_end}. DOTs ({colour_start|pop_text_poison}blight{colour_end} and {colour_start|pop_text_bleed}bleed{colour_end}) ignore PROT and are effective means to take down these highly armored opponents. Additionally, the {colour_start|notable}Honing Oil{colour_end} supply is a good supplement to deal with those enemies for heroes that lack any other options.

Les {colour_start|notable}attributs positifs{colour_end} sont désormais verrouillés par défaut, et ne seront pas remplacés. La {colour_start|notable}clinique{colour_end} pourra vous aider à retirer les {colour_start|notable}attributs positifs{colour_end} indésirables, pour un prix.

TODO:Some quirks develop as a result of ongoing combat against factional enemies. This can result in both {colour_start|notable}positive{colour_end} and {colour_start|harmful}negative{colour_end} quirks based on the specific factions that are fought.
TODO:Heroes can only have {colour_start|notable}4 Camping skills active{colour_end} at a time. Toggle the skills on and off by clicking on them.

TODO:Most abilities on heroes have seen some adjustments made to their stats and designs. Some of these changes are minute, and some are significant. Several abilities have also been replaced entirely. Area of Effect abilities now have a {colour_start|notable}Negative Crit Multiplier{colour_end}: 2 Target AoEs: -40% CRT 3 Target AoEs: -60% CRT 4 Target AoEs: -70% CRT

TODO:Your heroes all carry different beliefs in their hearts. Some are devout to the {colour_start|affiliation_religious}Light{colour_end}, some worship the {colour_start|affiliation_pagan}pagan{colour_end} deities, and some {colour_start|affiliation_faithless}reject the gods entirely{colour_end}. Each type of affiliation has different advantages and disadvantages in combat, and while some heroes cannot fall into certain faiths, they can only be one of the three.

TODO:Some of the items you find will have special "Oddity" frame. This means that the item can be carried back to Flameseeker and used during one of your future expeditions, if you wish for item to be used on a different hero.

TODO:Over time, some {colour_start|harmful}negative quirks{colour_end} will lock into place and become {colour_start|notable}severe{colour_end}. Severe{colour_start|harmful} negative quirks{colour_end} cost much more to remove in the Clinic.

TODO:If you find yourself uncertain on aspects of Black Reliquary, try using the Help Menu (using {colour_start|notable}[H]{colour_end} as a hotkey). There are multiple Help Menus available in different places; The Flameseeker, each airship facility, the provision menu, dungeon rooms, dungeon hallways, and in the middle of combat.

TODO:After you've completed the requirements of a quest, you have the option to {colour_start|notable}return to the Flameseeker{colour_end} at any time - just {colour_start|notable}click the crest{colour_end}. You don't need to return to the starting room of the dungeon to exit.

TODO:Heroes who have returned from a successful quest in the Darkest Dungeon have seen too much. Depending on which game mode and game options you have selected, they may choose to never go back, or simply will be stressed upon re-entry.

TODO:Each quest has {colour_start|notable}different goals and rewards{colour_end}, and each region has its own challenges. Experiment with various combinations to see what works! However, it's recommended to bring along a {colour_start|notable}Vestal{colour_end} or an {colour_start|notable}Occultist{colour_end} for healing.

TODO:Heroes gain {colour_start|notable}Resolve XP{colour_end} for each successful quest. {colour_start|notable}Resolve XP{colour_end} determines the hero's {colour_start|notable}Resolve Level{colour_end}. {colour_start|notable}Resolve XP{colour_end} gain and requirements have been adjusted to smooth out the progression curve for the course of Black Reliquary's campaign.

TODO:A critical scouting success will sometimes reveal a {colour_start|notable}Perfumer's Outpost{colour_end}! Advance to the marked tile, and press 'W' or click to enter. The mysterious Perfumer conducts his clandestine experiments in numerous locations around the valley. He is known to offer up strange and intriguing objects, asking people to return to him after observing their power.
TODO:You can sell back unwanted trinkets from your Trinket Inventory and make some money. Open the Trinket Inventory and [SHIFT-CLICK] on any trinket you don't want.

TODO:The ferry {colour_start|notable}allows you to recruit new heroes{colour_end}. {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[RIGHT-CLICK]{colour_end} on a hero's icon to view their information. {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[Drag and drop]{colour_end} them into your roster.
Le ferry est votre force vitale

TODO:While you're here, spend some of your starting relics on {colour_start|notable}upgrading the Ferry's Sails and Cabins{colour_end}. This will increase the number of heroes available here in the future. To upgrade click the {colour_start|notable}[+]{colour_end} symbol on the left, and then click the upgrade.

TODO:Many actions and experiences cause {colour_start|harmful}{colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end}{colour_end}. {colour_start|harmful}{colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end}{colour_end} damage appears above heroes' heads, in black type. {colour_start|harmful}{colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end}{colour_end} can also be {colour_start|notable}healed{colour_end}, and that appears in white type.

TODO:There are many ways for heroes to spend their time on the Flameseeker. Heroes can relieve {colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end} by taking part in activities at the {colour_start|notable}Galley{colour_end}. Or they can produce and interact with {colour_start|BR_heirloom}Refined Amber Dust{colour_end} in the {colour_start|notable}Amber Workshop{colour_end}. Both the {colour_start|notable}Amber Refinery{colour_end} and {colour_start|notable}Tek Exchange{colour_end} in the {colour_start|notable}Amber Workshop{colour_end} heal a very small amount of stress and {colour_start|notable}do not remove afflictions{colour_end}. Committing a hero to an activity {colour_start|notable}locks them in that activity{colour_end} until the {colour_start|notable}next Week{colour_end}. You'll have to take a different hero with you on your next quest.

TODO:The {colour_start|notable}light{colour_end} is fading! The current {colour_start|notable}torch level affects which enemies you may run into{colour_end}. The darker it gets, the more likely it is to run into challenging enemies which offer up greater rewards for defeating. {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[RIGHT-CLICK]{colour_end} on a torch from inventory to boost the light back up. Likewise, certain enemies will also only appear in bright light, although they do not give more loot.

Chaque héros possède de la place pour s'équiper de deux objets appelés {colour_start|notable}breloques{colour_end}. Il suffit de {colour_start|notable}faire glisser la breloque{colour_end} depuis l'inventaire sur {colour_start|notable}l'emplacement du héros sélectionné{colour_end}. Les {colour_start|notable}breloques{colour_end} présentent généralement un compromis : un avantage pour un inconvénient. Certaines sont également réservées à certaines classes.

{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLIC GAUCHE]{colour_end} ou {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[Z]{colour_end} devant une {colour_start|notable}porte{colour_end} permet de l'ouvrir.

TODO:Sometimes, heroes respond to the onslaught of {colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end} by becoming {colour_start|notable}VIRTUOUS{colour_end}! This elevated state of performance will last until they suffer a large amount of stress or return to the Flameseeker, and confers {colour_start|notable}stat bonuses{colour_end} and other benefits.

TODO:The Perfumer asks that you {colour_start|notable}bring his trinkets back to him{colour_end} at a later time so that he may gather more materials and apply experimental enhancements to them. Please note that this interaction only works if the trinket is dragged from the player's provision inventory. If the trinket is equipped, you must put it there before interacting. (Trinket interactions may appear invalid, but they still function as normal)

TODO:{colour_start|cursed_gem}Malignant Vestiges{colour_end} are a unique type of loot dropped mostly from Cactonid enemies. These exceedingly valuable treasures bring various penalties while in your inventory, so consider the effects carefully! These effects do not stack. Each vestige downside is only applied once while in your inventory. Cactonid fights are guaranteed to drop at least one vestige, and the {colour_start|cursed_gem}"Maligned"{colour_end} cactonids, summoned by performing an alum ritual near a cactonid, grant even more of them.

TODO:Yngolian drops {colour_start|yngolian1}Celestial{colour_end} trinkets. These special trinkets can be used in place of a standard torch to activate the Yngolian's Beacon, and in doing so will upgrade the trinket! [Remember that evolving trinkets must be placed in the inventory before they can be used on curios.]

TODO:Deception is everywhere!
Cactonids lie in wait to attack unsuspecting adventurers! {colour_start|notable}Most curios in the Treasury are disguised Cactonids ready to strike, but these creatures are overloaded with riches, both exotic and mundane.{colour_end} Certain interactions can be used to give yourself an advantage in fights against these floral beasts, so prepare accordingly.
While there are some roaming creatures which call the Treasury their home, most fights will be ones you initiate.
{colour_start|notable}Choose your fights carefully to bring home as many spoils as you can!{colour_end}
Écoutez attentivement. Ça pourrait vous sauver.
Diminutif de "précision". La probabilité de base de toucher résulte de l'ESQUIVE ennemie soustraite à la PRÉ.
TODO:A log of major events that occur on the ship each week. Can be accessed while in the Flameseeker.

Un état temporaire pouvant être déclenché lorsqu'un héros atteint 100 de stress. Les héros qui souffrent d'une affliction agissent de leur propre chef et voient leurs stats pénalisées. Les afflictions peuvent être soignées au navire en réduisant le stress du héros à l'atelier ou à la taverne.
TODO:A type of provision used to remove Blight. Antivenom ignores Blight Cure Received Chance debuffs. It also has uses on many dungeon curios.
L'armure d'un héros détermine son ESQUIVE et ses PV MAX de base. Elle peut être améliorée à la forge.
TODO:A type of provision used to remove Bleed. Bandages ignores Bleed Cure Received Chance debuffs. It also has uses on many dungeon curios.

Les héros et ennemis atteints d'un saignement subissent des dégâts à chaque tour de combat ou de déplacement dans les couloirs. Le saignement disparaît après un certain temps, mais peut être soigné avec des objets ainsi que certaines compétences de combat ou de campement.

Les héros et ennemis atteints d'une infection subissent des dégâts à chaque tour de combat ou de déplacement dans les couloirs. L'infection disparaît après un certain temps, mais peut être soignée avec des objets ainsi que certaines compétences de combat ou de campement.
TODO:A relic typically found in the Catacombs. Used to upgrade buildings on the ship.
Une compétence utilisée par un héros en campement.
Une compétence utilisée par un héros en combat.

TODO:Most dead monsters leave a temporary corpse. Corpses preserve the enemy order for a time and require heroes to use skills to attack around the corpses, move other enemies in reach, and so on. Alternatively, corpses can be attacked and cleared manually.
TODO:A relic found in Exposed Interior dungeons. Used to upgrade buildings in on the ship.
Diminutif de "chances de critique". Les coups critiques font plus de dégâts et réduisent le stress (crit de héros) ou l'augmentent (crit de monstre).
Coup subi par un héros à l'agonie et qui le tue définitivement.

TODO:Also known as "Mortality". A hero with 0 HP is at Death's Door. Each subsequent instance of damage taken while at Death's Door has a chance of permanently killing the hero. Additionally, each hit taken while on Death's Door will lower the hero's Deathblow Resist for 32 tns
TODO:Bonus towards resisting incoming debuffs and marks.
TODO:A relic typically found in the Caverns. Used to upgrade buildings on the Ship, as well as to produce Refined Amber Dust inside Amber Workshop.
TODO:A temporary sickness that debilitates the hero in some way. Disease Kits can tend the disease, but a fully evolved disease itself can only be cured in the Clinic.
TODO:Short for "damage". Determines how many health points, or HP, are removed from the target if an attack connects.
TODO:Dodge gets removed from the enemy's Accuracy to determine base chance to hit.
TODO:Commonly refers to the weapon and armor equipped to a hero, but can also include Trinkets. Weapons and armor cannot be unequipped but can be upgraded.
TODO:A type of provision used for Camping meals and other meals while wandering. Can be fed individually to a hero for a small HP recovery.
TODO:The basic currency of the Flameseeker. Used to purchase Trinkets, learn and upgrade skills, and upgrade Equipment.
Une crise cardiaque survient lorsqu'un héros en état d'affliction atteint 200 de stress. Le héros passe alors à l'agonie, ou meurt s'il y était déjà.
TODO:A special currency type that is most often used to upgrade buildings on the Ship. There are four types of Relics: Matakh, Amber, Salvaged Jewelry, and Valor Marks.
Un type de provision utilisé pour augmenter temporairement les résistances d'un héros. Également utile pour interagir avec certaines curiosités dans les donjons.
Diminutif de "points de vie". Les PV baissent en subissant des dégâts. Un héros avec 0 PV est à l'agonie.
TODO:A type of provision used to cure a hero's combat debuffs. Also can be used on dungeon curios.
TODO:An effect that moves the target forward or backward in the party lineup.
TODO:Bonus towards resisting enemy moves that cause a position change.

TODO:An object found in dungeons that impedes the party's progress. They can be removed by hand or with an item (usually Shovel). Clearing an obstacle by hand inflicts DMG and negative effects on the entire party.
TODO:A Relic typically found in the Treasury. Used to upgrade buildings on the Ship.
TODO:Short for "protection". Indicates what percentage of incoming damage is mitigated. DoTs (bleed, blight), effects and Expiated ignore PROT.
TODO:An item that can be added to the player's inventory before embarking on a quest, or found during it.

TODO:A character trait on a hero. Quirks can be beneficial (positive) or hindering (negative). Heroes may start with some quirks but acquire more through adventuring. Specific actions, such as attacking enemies or party members dying to enemies, have a chance to grant the hero specific quirks.
TODO:A stat that influences how likely a hero is to resist a particular status, such as Stun or Bleed.

TODO:The veteran level of a hero. A hero with higher Resolve Level can better resist stress, learn higher level skills and wield higher level equipment. Higher Resolve Level heroes will not waste their time on lower level quests. Low Resolve Level heroes adventuring in higher level dungeons will find it more stressful.
TODO:Earning Resolve XP progresses a hero towards the next Resolve Level. Resolve XP can only be earned by completing quests. Heroes do not earn Resolve XP if they abandon or fail quests.
L'ensemble des héros recrutés par le joueur.
Un type de provision servant à dégager les obstacles pour éviter de subir des DGT et du stress.
Provision utilisée dans les donjons pour interagir avec certaines curiosités.

Diminutif de "vitesse". Celle-ci influence l'ordre dans lequel les combattants agissent. Cet ordre est recalculé à chaque tour, par combattant. La valeur de base est de 1-12, à laquelle s'ajoutent les modificateurs.

TODO:Accrues as heroes travel through dungeons and engage in combat. When a hero reaches 100 stress, they acquire either an Affliction or a Virtue. At 200 stress, the hero suffers a heart attack if afflicted, or lose their Virtue if virtued.
An effect that forces the hero or enemy to pass on their next turn. Some stuns can last for an extended duration of time.
TODO:A type of provision. Used to increase the current torchlight within a dungeon.

TODO:The amount of light in a dungeon. Adventuring in brightness is safer but less rewarding, while adventuring in darkness is more dangerous but more rewarding. Can be increased by using torches and some combat skills.
TODO:A bonus towards avoiding or disarming traps.
TODO:A temporary condition of increased effectiveness that a hero acquires after passing an Affliction Check. Virtued heroes have buffs and may buff or otherwise increase the power of their allies.
TODO:A type of equipment used by a hero to combat the dangers found in dungeons. A hero's weapon determines their base DMG, CRT and SPD. Weapons can be upgraded at the Forge.
TODO:Made whenever a hero reaches 100 Stress and results in an Affliction or Virtue state.
TODO:Surprised heroes have their order jumbled. Heroes are surprised when Ambushed or randomly at the start of non-scouted enemy combats.
TODO:A hidden log of which Afflictions a particular hero has a tendency to develop.
TODO:An interactive prop found in a dungeon hallway or room.
TODO:Limited number of times that a skill may be used in each combat.

TODO:Monsters with Furtivité cannot be hit with direct attacks until Furtivité expires or is negated with a hero skill. AOE attacks CAN hit stealthed monsters, though, as long as there is any not-stealthed target to target!
TODO:Armor Piercing effects make attacks ignore part of target's PROT, which means the attack damage doesn't get reduced by protection as much.

TODO:Bubblenator is not a word in a dictionary. We just want to check how many people actually read those entries. You can redeem your award by going into trinket menu, pressing enter and typing "Reading Comprehension"
TODO:An indication of a disease that hero will get, if the symptom isn't tended to using Disease Kit nor cured in Clinic.
TODO:A tincture useful in the treatment of Horror (stress DOT). Also has interactions with some dungeon curios.
TODO:Ship upgrades available for the Flameseeker
TODO:Mechanical devices primarily used to construct Side Decks.
TODO:An expensive type of provision used to remove Symptoms and tend to the Diseases, lessening their effects.
TODO:Stat bonus received if both trinkets of that set are equipped at the same time.
TODO:An expensive type of provision used to disarm traps more easily. Used heavily in curio interactions.
TODO:A type of provision used to deal with high PROT enemies more efficiently. Can be used in curio interactions.
TODO:Describes Hero's religiousness. This can affect results of certain combat skills, camping skills, and more.
TODO:First round of the combat, during which attacks can't crit and have lowered accuracy. Some attacks ignore the accuracy penalty, and can have changed effects during it.

TODO:Heroes or enemies with Mark will take additional damage and effects from certain skills. For enemies, Marks will additionally make them target Marked hero more often. It will eventually go away after specific number of rounds, but can be removed early with Ginseng Powder.
TODO:A buff hero or enemy get after recovering from stun, which will grant them more resilience against further Stuns, consisting of both short-duration buffs and a smaller, combat-long one.

TODO:An effect that heals the opposing team of the expiated unit upon its next attack. The affected unit also takes damage after their next three attacks. Unholy enemies take 50% more damage, Pagan heroes take 50% more damage, Religious heroes receive 100% healing upon activation. Each activation of Expiation's healing reduces its effectiveness for the battle. This effect cannot stack.
TODO:An effect that heals and temporarily boosts target's DMG and CRT on kill. Lasts till the end of the Battle. This effect cannot stack.

TODO:An effect that debuffs target's DMG when they attack or Damage Received each time they use a friendly skill. Debuffs last for a single turn, while the status itself lasts until the end of the Battle. This effect cannot stack.

TODO:Conscripted by the Vizier, the Levantine forces are tasked with the excavation and recovery of Kvarotz relics and technology. They operate as trained soldiers, typically working together and fighting with advanced tactics.
TODO:A collective of zealous crusaders that have come to plunder the valley. They battle with the power of the Light, and are typically more effective against Pagan heroes.
TODO:Remnants of the vast Kvarotz Empire. Their sentinels and enforcers still roam the Valley in the dark, and are extremely dangerous to the bodies and minds of those caught in their wake.
TODO:A matriarchal clan of nomadic warriors who worship Pagan gods and the pursuit of unmatched power. They fight with the utmost brutality and relentless onslaughts.
TODO:An effect that applies Shuffle over specific amount of turns.
TODO:Number of rounds before a skill can be used again. Cooldowns are refreshed on combat end.

TODO:A refined version of Amber. Can be created in the Amber Refinery Activity in the Amber Workshop Facility on the Flameseeker, and occasionally found as loot. Used to purchase luxury provisions, use the Amber Den Activity, and to buy Contraband Trinkets.

TODO:The devolved creatures deep within the caverns, these insectoid savages practice sinister rituals and feast upon raw amber far below the surface. They wear down their opponents with overwhelming numbers rather than individual strength. Due to the their blindness they also completely ignore Furtivité.

TODO:These eldritch hybrids of flesh and flora have overgrown the Kvarotz treasury. They lie in wait, ready to spring upon victims who unwittingly spring their traps, bombarding their prey with various statuses.
TODO:Highly valuable treasures which apply debuffs to heroes while in the inventory. These debuffs do not stack with multiple of the same vestige. Mostly dropped by Cactonids in the Treasury.

TODO:Exposed Interior quests which subject heroes and enemies to the "Debilitating Daylight" torch effects, and are always set to 100 torchlight. {colour_start|skill_unselectable}Hero Effects: -8 DODGE, -4 SPD, Can't be Ambushed Monster Effects: -4 DODGE Torch Effects: Buff Hero Party: +5 ACC (1 Battle){colour_end}

TODO:Exposed Interior quests which subject heroes and enemies to the "Mantling Moonlight" torch effects, and are always set to 0 torchlight. {colour_start|skill_unselectable}Hero Effects: +3% CRT, +15% Stress Received Monster Effects: +5% CRT, Certain Enemies start battle with Furtivité Torch Effects: Buff Hero: Ignore Furtivité (1 tn){colour_end}
TODO:A consumable item which applies Damage Buff and Damage Received debuff to the hero. Buffs are halved for Religious and doubled for Pagan. Repeated use gives diminishing returns.
TODO:An item which grants 1 Block to its user. Can be purchased from the provision screen with Refined Amber Dust.
TODO:An item which grants temporary riposte to its user. Produced by the Adrenaline Manufactorum, and obtained from the provision screen.
TODO:An item which cures almost all statuses on its user. Can be purchased from the provision screen with Refined Amber Dust.
TODO:When a Frantic hero performs a non-fatal attack, they have a chance to be moved backwards and become horrified.
TODO:When a Leeched hero performs a friendly skill, they blight themselves and apply restoration to the enemy party.
TODO:An effect that restores health at the beginning of a hero's turn.

TODO:Items obtained using Perfumer's Needle, which can be used to debuff the enemy party. Type of Extract found depends on the Region you're in: Catacombs - Decrepit Extract - Debuffs PROT and Crit Received Exposed Interior - Rabid Extract - Debuffs ACC and CRT Caverns - Ancient Extract - Debuffs status chance Treasury - Living Extract - Debuffs Healing Received and Blight Resistance
TODO:Symptom which can be contracted via the Sérum nécrologique. If not treated, evolves into Peste goule. This disease prevents hero from getting any other diseases.

TODO:Disease which evolves from Fièvre goule. Alongside applying debuffs to your hero, it also increases likelihood of party encountering Ghouls. This disease prevents hero from getting any other diseases.

TODO:Symptom which can be contracted via the Parasite Zero. If not treated, evolves into Rictus Mortis. Alongside applying debuffs to your hero, this disease buffs the hero's SPD and CRT when Hexer consumes his Vials of Corruption. This disease prevents hero from getting any other diseases.

TODO:Diseases evolved from Rictus Imperfectus. Alongside applying debuffs to your hero, this disease buffs the hero's SPD and CRT when Hexer consumes his Vials of Corruption. This effect is removed if the disease is treated. This disease prevents hero from getting any other diseases.
TODO:Bounties can be obtained using "Big Prize" Contraband trinket, stack up to 99 per inventory slot, and they grant 200 gold each.

TODO:Special Exposed Interior quest which subject heroes and enemies to the "Encroaching Eclipse" torch effects, and are always set to 0 torchlight. {colour_start|skill_unselectable}Hero Effects: -20% Bleed Resist, -14% Deathblow Resist Monster Effects: +15% Bleed Resist Torch Effects: Target: Cure Bleed, +4 Stress{colour_end}
Une sangsue spéciale qui peut être utilisée pour retirer la foi d'un individu, le rendant athée.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Certains aspects du "Chasseur de la Flamme" pourront changer au cours du développement de Black Reliquary.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Black Reliquary est en cours de développement.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Les troglodytes sont résistants aux toxines et aux blessures, mais leur corps carapacé est facilement étourdi.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Les troglodytes sont couverts de substances qui peuvent provoquer des maladies. Préparez-vous en conséquence.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Les pelles ont des usages très variés dans ces galeries remplies de gravats.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Les bandages, qui permettent de collecter l'ambre en toute sécurité, seront très utiles dans ces grottes.

{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} La plupart des curios peuvent être abordées de différentes manières, afin d'obtenir des résultats différents.
{colour_start|white}⠼{colour_end} Vérifier régulièrement les bonus et les malus, de vos alliés et de vos ennemis, vous permettra de maîtriser la situation.
